arm_group.description: Patients undergone laparoscopic surgery in trendelemburg position
Patients undergone laparoscopic surgery not in trendelemburg position

brief_summary.textblock:
The purpose of this study is to determinate if the patients submitted to laparoscopic
      surgery in trendelemburg position develope more inadequate anaesthesic emergence than
      patients submitted to laparoscopic surgery in other positions.

clinical_study.brief_title: Inadequate Emergence After Laparoscopic Surgery in Trendelemburg Position

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  laparoscopic surgery

          -  general anaesthesia

          -  trendelemburg positioning

          -  extubated in the operatory theater

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  unable of communicate

          -  dementia

          -  psychiatric history

          -  neurosurgery

          -  alchohol and drugs addictions

facility.name: Anaesthesia and Reanimation Department, Hospital Parc Tauli

clinical_study.official_title: Inadequate Emergence After Anaesthesia in Laparoscopic Surgery in Trendelemburg Position

primary_outcome.description: The inadequate emergence after anaesthesia will be evalueted with the Richmond Agitation Sedation Scale, defining as inadequate emergence a punctuation >= +1 (delirium form) and <=-2 (hypoactive form).
primary_outcome.time_frame: 10 minutes after the arrival of the patient in the postsurgical unit

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Case Control, Time Perspective: Prospective
